page.title: 03ARCHITECTURAL MATERIALS
page.content: The Bush Estate, the other principal area of population, though at one time largly a holiday settlement, now has several permnant residents, though few amenities and unmade roads. {ARCHITECTURAL MATERIALS} The housing, in this coastal area of Sea Palling and Eccles, varies from traditional flint cottages with thatched roofs, to recently built bungalows and houses of factory- made red brick and concrete roof-tiled construction. Some of the old cottages have had their flint walls cement rendered and colour washed, and where the thatch has deteriorated, been re-roofed with Welsh slate. There are also some Victorian terraced villas of red brick which have slate roofs, and, closer to the sea, some sturdy houses of red brick and slate.
